statements.name: PROC VARIMPUTE
statements.description: The VARIMPUTE procedure performs variable imputation on a data table. Imputation is a common step in data preparation.
statements.help:
PROC VARIMPUTE  DATA=libref.data-table{ <options>};                 
	CODE <options>;                 
	FREQ  variable;                 
	INPUT  variables </options>;                 
	OUTPUT  OUT=libref.data-table<option>;                 
	WEIGHT  variable;

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the input data table for PROC VARIMPUTE to use

arguments.name: NTHREADS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of threads to be used

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: specifies an integer that is used to start the pseudorandom number generator

statements.name: CODE
statements.description: writes SAS DATA step code for computing predicted values of the fitted model to a file or to a table

arguments.name: COMMENT
arguments.description: Adds comments to the generated code

arguments.name: FILE=
arguments.description: Names the file in which to save the generated code

arguments.name: FORMATWIDTH=
arguments.description: Specifies the numeric format width for the regression coefficients

arguments.name: INDENTSIZE=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of spaces to indent the generated code

arguments.name: LABELID=
arguments.description: Specifies a number used to construct names and labels

arguments.name: LINESIZE=
arguments.description: Specifies the line size for the generated code

arguments.name: NOTRIM
arguments.description: Compares formatted values, including blank padding

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Names an output table in which to save the generated code

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: identifies a numeric variable in the input data table that contains the frequency of occurrence of each observation

statements.name: INPUT
statements.description: names one or more input variables and specifies the method that is used to impute missing values

arguments.name: CONTINUOUSTECH=
arguments.description: specifies the imputation method for interval variables

arguments.name: NOMINALTECH=
arguments.description: specifies the imputation method for nominal variables

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: creates an output data table to contain the results of PROC VARIMPUTE

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: names the output data table for PROC VARIMPUTE to use

arguments.name: COPYVAR=
arguments.description: lists one or more variables from the input data table to be transferred to the output data table

statements.name: WEIGHT
statements.description: variable is used to weight each observation to perform a weighted analysis of the data
